definitions.definition: a violent disturbance of the atmosphere with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, lightning, or snow.
examples: windstorm, tempest, whirlwind, gale, strong wind, high wind, squall; Morecyclone, tornado, twister, dust devil, dust storm; rainstorm, thunderstorm, thundershower; monsoon, typhoon, hurricane, tropical storm; hailstorm, snowstorm, blizzard "the coast was battered by a storm"Morecyclone, tornado, twister, dust devil, dust storm; rainstorm, thunderstorm, thundershower; monsoon, typhoon, hurricane, tropical storm; hailstorm, snowstorm, blizzard the coast was battered by a storm

definitions.definition: an intense low-pressure weather system; a cyclone.
examples: noun: storm system; plural noun: storm systems

definitions.definition: a wind of force 10 on the Beaufort scale (48–55 knots or 55-63 mph).
a heavy discharge of missiles or blows.
examples: two men were taken by a storm of bullets

definitions.definition: a tumultuous reaction; an uproar or controversy.
examples: the book caused a storm in South America
synonyms: row "there was a storm over his remarks"

definitions.definition: a violent or noisy outburst of a specified feeling or reaction.
examples: the disclosure raised a storm of protest

definitions.definition: a direct assault by troops on a fortified place.
move angrily or forcefully in a specified direction.
examples: she burst into tears and stormed off

definitions.definition: move forcefully and decisively to a specified position in a game or contest.
examples: he barged past and stormed to the checkered flag

definitions.definition: (of troops) suddenly attack and capture (a building or other place) by means of force.
examples: Indian commandos stormed a hijacked plane early today

definitions.definition: (of the weather) be violent, with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, lightning, or snow.
examples: when it stormed in the day, I shoveled the drive before Harry came home
